name: 陳岡伯
objective: In the second semester, apart from further refining students' writing skills (in the modes of classification and extended definition), the course will also introduce key theoretical approaches in literary and cultural studies to help students establish their arguments and methodologies of their senior projects. Students will read excerpts from original theoretical texts and critical essays that involve theoretical frameworks and write a full research paper at the end of the semester.
schedule:
Week 1 (2/21): Introduction to the course and reviewing the common errors/defects in the 2 essays written in last semester 
Week 2: National holiday 
Week 3 (3/7): Classification essay: exercise  
Week 4 (3/14): Extended definition: exercise
Week 5 (3/21):  Introduction to theories, methods of critical reading, psychoanalysis
Week 6 (3/28): Psychoanalysis
Week 7 (4/4): National holiday
Week 8 (4/11): Psychoanalysis
Week 9 (4/18): Feminism & queer studies 
Week 10 (4/25): Feminism & queer studies
Week 11 (5/2): Feminism & queer studies
Week 12 (5/9): Power & discourse 
Week 13 (5/16): Power & discourse
Week 14 (5/23): Power & discourse
Week 15 (5/30): Postcolonial studies 
Week 16 (6/6): Postcolonial studies
Week 17 (6/13): Postcolonial studies
Week 18 (6/20): final group exercise
scorePolicy:
Attendance and participation (including in-class exercises): 20%
final group presentation: 20%
2 essays, due on 25 April & 26 June : 40%
materials:
All reading materials will be provided by the instructor.

Theoretical texts:
Sigmund Freud, "The Ego and the Id," "The Ego and the Super-Ego"
Simone de Beauvoir, "Introduction" to The Second Sex
Michel Foucault, Excerpts from Discipline and Punish
Edward Said, "Introduction" to Orientalism

Films for discussion:
Thelma & Louis (1991)
The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
"The Blind Banker" from BBC's Sherlock (2011)
